parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
(a) a maker, poet, (b) a doer, carrier out, performer. From poieo; a performer; specially, a 'poet'.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
A hearer of, a listener to. From akroaomai; a hearer.
Alone, but, only. Neuter of monos as adverb; merely.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To deceive, beguile, reason falsely, mislead. From para and logizomai; to misreckon, i.e. Delude.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
